etymologies: 1920s; earliest use found in Pharmacopeia United States. From methene + amine

definitions: The compound hexamethylenetetramine, (CH₂)₆ N₄, or a derivative of this (often with mandelic acid), especially when used as a urinary antiseptic.

notes.text: Hexamine is the preferred name in the British Pharmacopoeia.

definitions: In full "methenamine silver". A solution of methenamine and silver nitrate, used in several histological stains.
